sources.title: Sing Sing Nights
sources.description: Probably the only movie based on a novel by Harry Stephen Keeler. Note: there are many video dropouts during the first 5 minutes.

sources.title: Sing Sing Nights (1934) MYSTERY
sources.description:
Stars: Conway Tearle, Ferdinand Gottschalk, Hardie Albright
Director: Lewis D. Collins

An international war corespondent is found murdered with three bullet wounds, each fired from a different gun. Three men are arrested for the murder, and each one confesses to the crime. All three are convicted and sentenced to death. However, a criminologist decides to use a new kind of lie detector to identify of the real murderer, but must act quickly before the men are all put to death!

metadata.Plot: A respected war correspondent is found murdered, with three bullets--from three different guns--in him. Three different men are arrested, convicted and sentenced to death for the murder, but only one can be the actual killer. A criminologist sets out to find who is really guilty.
metadata.Writer: Harry Stephen Keeler, Marion Orth, Charles Logue
metadata.Actors: Conway Tearle, Hardie Albright, Ferdinand Gottschalk
